title: 'Death to Islamic Republic': Iran protests get angrier, buildings set on fire ‚Äî watch
content: Nationwide protests against Iran's religious dictatorship escalated with protesters setting fire to government buildings, prompting the government to cut off internet and international phone services. Violence has resulted in at least 42 deaths and over 2,270 detentions, as economic grievances fuel broader anti-government demonstrations.

title: 'Decisions will echo for 10 yrs': Ex-captain Tamim Iqbal warns B'desh over T20 WC call
content: Former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal urged the BCB to carefully consider the national team's T20 World Cup participation, warning against hasty decisions driven by public emotion. He emphasized prioritizing Bangladesh cricket's long-term future and suggested dialogue over public pronouncements. Iqbal stressed the BCB's need for independent decision-making while acknowledging government involvement.

title: Amazon HR email to staff: ‚ÄòWhat you did last year‚Äô; asked to list specific wins and growth plans
content: Amazon is now demanding corporate employees detail three to five key accomplishments annually, a shift from broader self-assessments. This new 'Forte' performance review focuses on measurable impact and innovation, even highlighting unsuccessful risks. This move signals a broader trend in Silicon Valley towards increased accountability and discipline in the tech sector.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 36: Film ends 5th week with Rs 51 crore
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive theatrical run, crossing Rs 790 crore domestically and nearing Rs 1270 crore worldwide. The film, starring Ranveer Singh and others, has shown remarkable box office stamina, even outperforming its opening week in the second. It's on the cusp of becoming the fourth highest-grossing Indian film globally, poised to surpass 'RRR'.

title: Tilak ruled out: 'Sarpanch sahab should be picked' - Ex-India opener backs Iyer
content: Former India opener Aakash Chopra strongly advocates for Shreyas Iyer's immediate inclusion in the T20I squad. He believes Iyer is the ideal replacement for the injured Tilak Varma, emphasising the need for middle-order stability and experience ahead of a crucial white-ball calendar. Chopra sees Iyer as the most logical choice, even over other contenders like Riyan Parag.

title: Musk impressed with China, says 'Does things I say'; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk noted China's rapid adoption of electric vehicles, batteries, and solar power, mirroring his suggestions. He emphasized batteries as key to boosting US energy output without new power plants. Tesla's Megapacks and Megablock offer utility-scale storage solutions. Musk also warned of potential silver price hikes due to Chinese export restrictions.

title: Will Reliance buy Venezuelan oil? ‚ÄòAwait clarity on non-US buyers‚Äô - here‚Äôs what it said
content: Reliance Industries is considering resuming Venezuelan crude oil purchases if non-US buyers are permitted, awaiting regulatory clarity. Other Indian refiners like Indian Oil Corp and Hindustan Petroleum Corp are also open to Venezuelan oil under similar conditions. This potential shift comes as India faces pressure to reduce Russian oil imports.

title: Larry Bird & Dinah Mattingly net worth: NBA earnings, endorsements and more
content: NBA legend Larry Bird, a three-time champion with the Boston Celtics, boasts a remarkable career marked by numerous accolades. Beyond his on-court success, Bird has maintained a private personal life, with two marriages and adopted children. His estimated net worth, combined with his wife, Dinah Mattingly, reflects his enduring career earnings and brand endorsements.

title: Big relief for Vijay: 'Jana Nayagan' gets Madras HC clearance; U/A certificate ordered
content: The Madras High Court has ordered the CBFC to immediately issue a U/A certificate for Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan', quashing the chairperson's letter as "without jurisdiction." Justice PT Asha deemed the complainant's grievance an "afterthought." Despite the court's relief, the film's release is delayed due to "unavoidable circumstances," with a new date to be announced soon.

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page are 'cutting ties' with America's Silicon Valley
content: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: Land-for-jobs 'scam': Delhi court frames corruption, cheating charges against Lalu Yadav and family
content: A Delhi court has framed criminal charges against Lalu Prasad Yadav, his wife Rabri Devi, and their children in the alleged Railways land-for-jobs scam. The court found a prima facie case of corruption, cheating, and criminal conspiracy, stating public employment was used to acquire properties. Charges have been framed against 46 of the 98 accused.

title: Stock market today: Which stocks are the top gainers & losers on Nifty50, BSE Sensex
content: Indian stock markets traded in the red on Friday, with Nifty50 below 26,000 and Sensex down over 400 points. Concerns over US tariffs on Russian crude imports and heavy foreign investor outflows weighed on sentiment. Experts suggest markets may stabilize after recent declines, with investors awaiting earnings season for direction.

title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs my fault‚Äô: What ICE shooting victim‚Äôs partner said after her death
content: A woman, Rebecca Good, sobbed "it's my fault" after her wife, Renee Nicole Good, was fatally shot by an ICE agent in Minneapolis. Renee drove at the officer during an ICE operation, leading to the shooting. The couple, new to Minneapolis from Kansas City, had a young child at school.

title: ‚ÄòBroke down in tears‚Äô: WB man waiting in SIR queue collapses, dies of heart attack
content: A 38-year-old man died of a heart attack after waiting in a long queue for a hearing related to corrections under the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) process. His family alleges that severe anxiety over the process, fearing exclusion, led to his death. State minister condemned the incident, stating over 50 deaths have occurred in connection with the SIR process.

title: Oscars 2025: ‚ÄòKantara Chapter 1‚Äô enters race; ‚ÄòTanvi The Great‚Äô also in list
content: A groundbreaking moment for Indian cinema unfolds at the 98th Academy Awards, as Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: A Legend‚ÄîChapter 1' and Anupam Kher's 'Tanvi The Great' vie for the prestigious Best Picture nomination. Both films have navigated the rigorous eligibility requirements established by the Academy, including their notable theatrical releases and adherence to representation standards.

title: Mahua, Derek dragged away from outside Amit Shah's office; TMC protests over I-PAC raid
content: TMC leaders, including MPs, were detained protesting ED raids on I-PAC offices in Kolkata. The party alleges the raids, targeting election strategy data, are politically motivated harassment by the Union government ahead of West Bengal polls. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condemned the action, calling it a vendetta and accusing the BJP of attempting to steal party documents.

title: Union Budget 2026: Building India‚Äôs financial security architecture
content: Despite rising disposable incomes, a significant share of Indian households, especially those dependent on a single breadwinner, remains one income shock or medical emergency away from financial distress.

title: Would Litton or Soumya face same heat as Mustafizur, asks ex-BCB official
content: Ex-Bangladesh Cricket Board official Syed Ashraful Haque criticised political meddling in cricket administration, saying the Mustafizur Rahman row reflects how World Cup matters are being driven by immature, election-linked politics rather than sporting logic, potentially jeopardising Bangladesh‚Äôs participation

title: 'Shoot first, ask questions later': Denmark's warning to Trump; tensions soar over Greenland
content: Denmark has warned its troops are under standing orders to "shoot first and ask questions later" if Greenland is attacked, as Europe grows anxious over potential US military action. The US is reportedly considering cash payments to Greenlanders to encourage independence from Denmark, a move European leaders are rallying against.

title: Gold price prediction: Here's the outlook for today; Why you should ‚Äòsell on rise‚Äô
content: Gold price prediction today: Jateen Trivedi, VP Research Analyst - Commodity and Currency, LKP Securities is of the view that gold prices are facing upside resistance. Here's his outlook and trading strategy

title: T20 WC: 'Ball in Bangladesh's court' - Indian govt assures warm welcome to all nations
content: The Indian government is monitoring the Bangladesh situation regarding the T20 World Cup and will follow its sports policy of welcoming all participating nations. Bangladesh's decision to withdraw or relocate matches remains solely theirs, with India awaiting their final stance. Unlike Pakistan, where a specific sports policy exists, Bangladesh will receive full security if they choose to participate.

title: Next target Mexico? After Venezuela, Trump eyes 'drug cartels'; warns of land strikes
content: US President Trump is now eyeing Mexico for operations against drug cartels, following recent actions in Venezuela.  He stated a desire to "hit land" within Mexico, a move that would significantly escalate US military involvement.  Mexican President Sheinbaum has pushed back, asserting regional autonomy. This comes after US strikes on suspected drug-trafficking vessels.

title: Bengaluru road rage: Zepto delivery executive beaten, hit on chest with helmet
content: A Zepto delivery executive was assaulted by two scooty riders after a minor collision in Mahadevpura. The attackers reportedly used a helmet and punches, leaving the executive vulnerable. An elderly bystander intervened, confronting the assailants and helping to end the attack. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Rupee in red: Currency falls 7 paise in early trade; reaches 89.97 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee weakened against the US dollar on Friday, trading at 89.97 due to persistent foreign investor selling and rising global crude oil prices. US tariffs and a subdued domestic stock market also contributed to the pressure.  The Reserve Bank of India has been actively intervening to manage the rupee's volatility.

title: 'Daal roti nahi chalti ...': Virat Kohli's brother slams critics
content: India batter Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas, has defended the cricketer against critics, suggesting some use Virat's name for relevance. This comes after former player Sanjay Manjrekar's comments on Kohli's Test career. Meanwhile, Kohli is preparing for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand, aiming to continue his exceptional recent form.

title: Goa MP, a Kargil veteran, gets SIR notice; CEO slams BLO for goof-up
content: South Goa MP Capt Viriato Fernandes received an Election Commission notice to prove his identity, prompting the state CEO to blame a BLO for dereliction of duty. The system auto-generated the notice due to unmapped voter details, but the MP's name will be retained after clarification.

title: One killed, several injured in Philippines landfill collapse; at least 38 trapped
content: A devastating garbage avalanche at a Cebu City waste facility tragically claimed one life and left many missing.  Twelve workers were rescued alive from the collapsed debris, but fears remain for at least 38 others believed trapped.  Search and rescue operations are ongoing, with authorities prioritizing aid for affected families.

title: Delhi-NCR sees season's lowest at 4.6¬∞C after unexpected early morning rain
content: Delhi-NCR experienced an unexpected early Friday rain spell, intensifying the cold wave and failing to significantly improve alarmingly high air pollution levels. The showers, accompanied by cold winds, lowered the chill factor, with minimum temperatures expected around 6¬∞C. Dense fog is also anticipated, with cold-day conditions likely to persist across northern and central regions.

title: Anthony Edwards joins elite group with LeBron James, Kevin Durant after Cavs win
content: Anthony Edwards has etched his name in NBA history, becoming the third-fastest player to surpass 10,000 career points before his 25th birthday, trailing only legends LeBron James and Kevin Durant. This remarkable achievement, coupled with his stellar season averages, propels the Minnesota Timberwolves forward as they extend their winning streak. Edwards' consistent brilliance continues to lead his team to victory.

title: 'Cannot support all his beliefs': Tharoor calls himself 'uncritical fan' of Nehru
content: Shashi Tharoor, while respecting Jawaharlal Nehru as India's democratic founder, acknowledged his mistakes, stating the Modi government unfairly scapegoats him.  He noted the 1962 China war defeat as a potential Nehru misstep, but criticized blaming him for all current issues. Tharoor also shared personal anecdotes about his writing journey and Kerala's reading culture.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' gets clearance: Madras HC clears Vijay's movie; orders U/A certificate
content: Madras High Court has directed the CBFC to grant a 'UA 16+' censor certificate for the theatrical release of actor Vijay's Tamil movie 'Jana Nayagan'. The court set aside the chairperson's decision to refer the film to a revising committee, emphasizing that the producer invested Rs 500 crore and had already made 27 modifications as per board recommendations.

title: T20 WC standoff: Bangladesh sends second letter to ICC, reiterates venue shift from India
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has formally requested the ICC to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka due to security concerns. The team has refused to travel to India, escalating uncertainty just weeks before the tournament. The BCB's stance has hardened following the IPL release of Mustafizur Rahman.

title: Writing on the wall? Delhi University bids adieu to ‚Äòwalls of democracy‚Äô
content: Delhi University has reportedly denotified its designated 'Walls of Democracy' where students could post notices and express opinions. This move came after security staff prevented students from pasting posters, tearing them down and informing them of the university's decision.

title: 'Don't need international law': Trump says 'my own morality' only restraint on global power
content: US President Donald Trump asserted his "own morality" as the sole limit on his power to order military action globally, even as he spoke of peace.  His administration has pursued an aggressive military posture, launching operations in Venezuela and threatening other nations, while Trump also expressed a desire for US "ownership" of Greenland.

title: PSL expansion - Two franchises sold for less than IPL superstars' paycheques
content: The Pakistan Super League is expanding to eight teams for the 2026 season, with two new franchises sold for a combined $12.75 million. This figure highlights a significant financial disparity compared to the Indian Premier League, where even individual player salaries and franchise valuations far exceed these new PSL team prices, underscoring the IPL's immense economic power.

title: ‚ÄòShe behaved horribly, ran over him‚Äô: Trump defends ICE agent who shot Minneapolis woman dead
content: US President Trump defended an ICE agent after a fatal shooting in Minneapolis, claiming the woman tried to run over the officer. The woman, Renee Nicole Good, was killed by multiple shots fired into her car during a federal operation. Local leaders disputed the federal account, with the mayor calling for ICE to leave the city.

title: Mystery murder: 30-year-old‚Äôs body chopped into 6 pieces; head stuffed in drum
content: A 30-year-old man was found brutally murdered and dismembered in Ludhiana, his head discovered in a drum. Police have registered a case against his friend and the friend's wife, who were captured on CCTV carrying the drum. The motive is currently under investigation.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,900; BSE Sensex up over 140 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmarks, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, rose in trade on Friday after days of fall. While Nifty50 was above 25,900, BSE Sensex was up almost 150 points.

title: What happens if Trump's tariffs are struck down? Traders 'worried' for $150 bn refunds
content: US companies and trade lawyers are bracing for a potential $150 billion refund battle as the Supreme Court hears a case challenging President Trump's use of emergency powers for global tariffs. The outcome hinges on whether the International Emergency Economic Powers Act grants authority for such duties, with skepticism from justices fueling expectations of tariffs being struck down.

title: Prada bottles the warmth and comfort of chai with Infusion de Santal Chai perfume
content: Italian luxury brand Prada has launched a new unisex fragrance, Infusion de Santal Chai, inspired by the popular Indian beverage. This scent blends creamy sandalwood with spicy chai latte notes, enhanced by citrus and cardamom for a warm yet fresh aroma. The unique perfume aims to capture the comforting essence of chai, sparking curiosity and debate among consumers.

title: Canes head home in pursuit of title: 'Not finished'
content: Carson Beck scrambled for a 3-yard touchdown with 18 seconds left, and Miami will head back home for a shot at its first national championship since 2001 after beating Mississippi 31-27 in an exhilarating CFP semifinal at the Fiesta Bowl.

title: Miami's Lewis encourages Lacy, resilient Rebels
content: Hurricanes great Ray Lewis pulled Ole Miss running back Kewan Lacy aside after Thursday night's CFP semifinal, offering advice that reinforced the values of a Rebels team that never quit.

title: QB Williams runs reverse, stays at Washington
content: QB Demond Williams Jr., who initially signed a big-money deal with Washington only to announce he was entering the transfer portal days later, has decided to remain with the Huskies.

title: Ravens' Monken: 'Didn't coach Lamar well enough'
content: OC Todd Monken accepted the blame for quarterback Lamar Jackson's regression in his third season in the system, telling the "Ryan Ripken Show" he "didn't coach Lamar well enough" and "didn't have as good of a relationship as I could have [with him]."

title: Wolves hold moment of silence for Renee Good
content: The Timberwolves held a moment of silence before their game Thursday night for the 37-year-old woman fatally shot in her car by an ICE officer.

title: Gold medalist Kim injured ahead of Winter Games
content: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Chloe Kim said Thursday that she dislocated a shoulder in training and her status for the Winter Games is uncertain.

title: Heat-Bulls PPD due to condensation on court
content: The scheduled game between the Chicago Bulls and Miami Heat was postponed because of condensation on the court in Chicago on Thursday night.

title: Skubal, Tigers face arbitration as deadline passes
content: Tarik Skubal and the Tigers failed to agree on a contract for this season before Thursday night's deadline to avoid arbitration, Detroit announced.

title: üèÄ Six NBA trade offers to reshape playoff chase
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: Connelly breaks down College Football Playoff semifinals
content: Our deep dive into the semifinals dissects the matchups that will determine who moves on to the title game.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings now that we're midway through the offseason.

title: The bizarre world of arbitration -- and the ace whose record raise could rock the system
content: Baseball's unique offseason contract process is built on comps. Enter the pitcher who is beyond comparison.

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: WNBPA president Nneka Ogwumike and VP Napheesa Collier applaud player solidarity but bemoan a lack of progress in CBA negotiations.

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Browns locked in for 'next 120 days': Coach, draft and a QB
content: Are Cleveland's owners letting a 5-12 season weigh them down? Not a chance. They're pressing forward.

title: 'Even if it's not safe, I still want to play': What NHL players, owners, execs are saying about Olympic ice
content: While the rink won't be perfect, there's also an overwhelming sentiment shared by all stakeholders: The men's Olympic hockey tournament will go on.

title: Arsenal still in control of title race; Liverpool show they need to improve
content: Both Arsenal and Liverpool settled for a point in a scoreless draw, but it was a missed opportunity for the Gunners to extend their lead in the Premier League.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: Power Rankings: Unbeaten Vanderbilt, Nebraska crack top 10
content: The Commodores and Cornhuskers have outperformed preseason expectations, headlining this week's biggest risers.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Secret sauce to Bills beating the Jaguars? A big key is the O-line
content: What makes up the Bills O-line unit's success and its diverse personalities off the field? Let them explain.

title: Mendoza vs. Moore: Why the CFP semifinals will have a big impact on the NFL draft
content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Buzz: Hoosiers-Ducks winner likely to be favorite in national championship game
content: The winner of Friday's semifinal between Indiana and Oregon is expected to be the favorite in the national title game, regardless of opponent.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: Newest layer in the Packers-Bears rivalry? Cheese grater hats
content: DJ Moore's celebration helped turn a foam cheese grater hat into the latest Bears-Packers rivalry fixture.

title: Men's hockey check-in: Which teams are poised for a Frozen Four run?
content: A look at the top storylines, players to watch and Frozen Four picks as we hit the season's second half.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Fundora moves up; a new name in the top 10
content: Gabriela Fundora keeps moving up and Elif Nur Turhan scored another impressive TKO victory. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Knueppel, Adebayo headline biggest surprises and disappointments
content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: Ja'Marr Chase offered an ARC Raiders player Bengals season tickets for a revive
content: The Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver tried to bargain for his virtual life in ARC Raiders -- to no avail.

title: Centre opposes in High Court plea to reduce GST on air purifiers, says judicial intervention impermissible
content: The petition filed by advocate Kapil Madan said air purifiers cannot be treated as luxury items in view of the ‚Äúextreme emergency crisis‚Äù caused by severe air pollution in Delhi

title: CHCs, PHCs in five locations in Kalaburagi upgraded
content: Among other things, the existing 30-bed Community Health Centres (CHCs) at Kalagi and Yadrami, both taluk headquarters, have been upgraded to 50-bed facilities

title: Himachal HC directs State govt to conduct elections to Panchayati Raj bodies before April 30
content: Maintaining that the State has suffered extensive damage to public and private properties and roads, the State government had urged the SEC to put the election process on hold till the situation improved on the ground

title: Daughter of former Madhya Pradesh Home Minister among three killed in road accident near Indore
content: The accident occurred near the Ralamandal area on the Tejaji Nagar bypass when a car collided with a truck, Tejaji Nagar police station in charge Devendra Markam told PTI

title: Amit Shah launches NSG's national IED data platform
content: The platform will collect and analyse improvised explosive device (IED) data gathered from across the country and disseminate it to security agencies

title: Kerala CM acting to fulfil PM Modi‚Äôs wishes, alleges Ramesh Chennithala
content: Chennithala describes CPI(M) and BJP as ‚Äòallies‚Äô, claiming that ‚ÄòBJP makes statements on behalf of the Chief Minister and vice versa‚Äô

title: Pune film fest: First internationally co-produced Assamese film chosen
content: An India-Israel project, ‚ÄòMurder Too Close ‚Äì Love Too Far‚Äô has been co-directed by Manju Borah and Dan Wolman

title: TMC MPs stage protest outside Home Ministry office over raids on I-PAC, detained
content: TMC MPs O'Brien, Satabdi Roy, Mahua Moitra, Bapi Haldar, Saket Gokhale, Pratima Mondal, Kirti Azad and Sharmila Sarkar were among those who took part in the protest.

title: Trade unions must unite to counter anti-worker policies, says Elamaram Kareem
content: Elamaram Kareem, recently elected general secretary of CITU, emphasises trade union unity to combat ‚Äòanti-worker policies‚Äô and protect workers‚Äô rights amid evolving labour challenges. He says all organisations, including BMS, are welcome to join collective action against Union government‚Äôs such policies

title: Jaishankar meets French President Macron, appreciates 'positive sentiments' for strategic partnership
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar, who is on a six-day visit to France and Luxembourg, also addressed the Ambassadors‚Äô Conference of France on January 8, 2026

title: Calibrated capitulation: Congress claims govt planning to lift curbs on Chinese firms bidding for Indian contracts
content: Opposition party also demanded that Prime Minister Narendra Modi must explain his Government's sudden "U-turns" on China policy during the forthcoming Budget Session of Parliament

title: India participates in border coordination meet ahead of Nepal elections
content: The purpose of the meet is to ensure peace, security and administrative coordination along the International Border in view of upcoming elections in Nepal

title: Parties abandoning ideologies, poaching leaders through money, muscle and fear: Ajit Pawar
content: Ajit Pawar alleged that some leaders are being poached through inducements, while others are pressured by highlighting pending inquiries against them and assuring that probe agencies would be managed after a switch

title: ‚ÄòBhrasht Janata Party‚Äô: Rahul slams BJP's double engine govts in various States
content: Rahul Gandhi cited the murder of Ankita Bhandari in Uttarakhand, the Unnao rape case in Uttar Pradesh, deaths from drinking contaminated water in Indore, among others, to attack the BJP

title: ‚ÄòJana Nayagan‚Äô censor row: Madras High Court orders to grant U/A certificate to Vijay-starrer, CBFC files appeal
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan agree to consider a request made on behalf of the CBFC for an urgent hearing of the appeal against Justice P.T. Asha‚Äôs order

title: Justice Mahesh Sharadchandra Sonak sworn in as Chief Justice of Jharkhand High Court
content: Chief Minister Hemant Soren, Chief Secretary Avinash Kumar and other senior officials were present on the occasion.

title: India-U.S. trade deal didn‚Äôt happen because Modi did not call Trump: Lutnick
content: Howard Lutnick‚Äôs remarks came a few days after Mr. Trump said that Mr. Modi knew he was unhappy with India's purchases of Russian oil and that Washington could raise tariffs on New Delhi "very quickly"

title: Nainar Nagenthran meets Palaniswami ahead of PM Modi‚Äôs visit to T.N.
content: ‚ÄúTalks have been cordial. We discussed the visit of the Prime Minister. We will (further) discuss whether the meeting will be in Chennai or Madurai,‚Äù Mr. Nagenthran told reporters after the meeting with Mr. Palaniswami

title: Cathlab¬†embolisation¬†performed on 13-year-old dog in Pune
content: A 13-year-old Labrador with severe anemia, low platelets, and large liver‚Äìspleen tumors underwent¬†cathlab-guided¬†embolisation¬†at a Pune clinic.¬†¬†

title: Delhi Police arrests another accused in Turkman Gate stone-pelting case
content: We have arrested Mohd Imran (36). Further investigation is underway. Security will remain tightened in the area, says Additional Commissioner of Police (Central) Nidhin Valsan

title: Land-for-jobs case: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu Prasad, others
content: The CBI filed charge sheets against Lalu Prasad, his wife and former Bihar Chief Minister Rabri Devi, their son Tejashwi Yadav and others in connection with the alleged scam

title: 6-day Sri Mailaralingeshwar annual festival in Mailapur in Yadgir district of Karnataka to begin on January 12
content: Deputy Commissioner Harshal Bhoyar directed officials to organise the annual fair peacefully and ensure that all basic facilities, including drinking water and makeshift toilets, are put in place for devotees

title: Lighter school bags, classrooms without ‚Äòbackbenchers‚Äô: Kerala‚Äôs new lesson plan
content: A draft report proposing a reduction in weight of school bags and creating classrooms without 'backbenchers' has been approved by State Curriculum Steering Committee, General Education Minister V. Sivankutty has said

title: CUK‚Äôs language lab emerges as key platform for strengthening English skills among rural students in Karnataka
content: Centre for English Language Teaching (CELT) follows a learner-centric and need-based approach, first identifying gaps in students‚Äô language skills and then preparing customised content with emphasis on grammar, vocabulary and core communication skills

title: Mamata protest in Kolkata LIVE: TMC MLAs detained during protest outside Amit Shah‚Äôs office
content: ED seeks CBI probe against CM Mamata, top police officials in I-PAC raid case for allegedly obstructing its raids in Kolkata against political consultancy firm I-PAC and its director.¬†

title: The Hindu Group signs MoU with RV Institute of Technology and Management in Bengaluru
content: Citing the ‚ÄòGo Change the World‚Äô motive, college Principal Nagashettappa Biradar emphasised carrying this vision forward by empowering students to enhance their communication and writing abilities

title: Malayalam Language Bill, 2025: What it proposes and why it has triggered opposition outside Kerala | Explained
content: In October, Kerala Assembly passed Malayalam Language Bill, establishing Malayalam as State‚Äôs sole official language for government, education, and commerce. The Bill, which awaits Governor‚Äôs assent, has faced opposition, especially from Karnataka govt, citing concerns for Kannada-speaking residents in Kasaragod. But Kerala Law Minister has argued that the Bill includes protections for linguistic minorities

title: Studio Green rushes to Madras High Court to get Karthi-starrer Vaa Vaathiyar released
content: The production house urges the court to modify its December 2025 order prohibiting the release of the movie without paying ‚Çπ21.78 crore

title: Now, vehicle owners needn‚Äôt take vehicles to RTA offices for registration
content: As per the new stipulation, vehicle buyers will no longer be required to take their new vehicles to RTOs for inspection as part of the registration process

title: Indian top IT firms set for another tepid quarter on weak U.S. demand, client spending
content: Brokerages expect the top six IT firms by revenue to post about 4% year-on-year revenue growth and a 5% rise in profit for the December quarter on average

title: High Court verdict in plea over Telangana DGP appointment today
content: On October 10, city-based social activist T. Dhangopal Rao filed a writ petition challenging the appointment of IPS officer B. Shivadhar Reddy as the State Director General of Police

title: Supreme Court sets aside A.P. HC order quashing FIRs filed by ACB
content: The apex court directs the accused public servants to cooperate for the speedy conclusion of the probe

title: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah urges Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to withdraw Malayalam Bhasha Bill 2025
content: The Karnataka Border Area Development Authority petitioned Kerala Government on Wednesday urging him to reject the bill; Karnataka government fears the bill have negative impact on Kannada speaking linguistic minority in Kerala

title: Pakistan to take up with India any development activity in violation of IWT: Foreign Office
content: Foreign Office spokesperson Tahir Andrabi also said that the IWT remains a binding international instrument and there is no provision for abeyance of the treaty

title: Telangana land owner on ground, not in official records
content: Decades-old Sada Bainamas ‚Äî informal, plain-paper land agreements ‚Äî have left over nine lakh farmers in Telangana without titles as procedural hurdles and record discrepancies stall regularisation under the Bhu Bharati Act, 2025. Small and marginal farmers are calling for Gram Sabha verifications and clearer rules to secure ownership and reduce disputes, report¬†M. Rajeev, P. Sridhar and P. Laxma Reddy

title: Chittoor poised for a white revolution
content: On the road to recovery from a severe setback it suffered years ago following the closure of the Cooperative Milk Producers‚Äô Union, Chittoor district's dairy sector is set for a big leap riding on the relentless efforts of small and marginal farmers who constitute the buik of its operations, and the multi-pronged strategy rolled out by the government may turn out to be the much-needed push to shift the gear, writes  K. Umashanker

title: 'Will Do A Better Deal': Trump On Expiring US-Russia Nuclear Treaty
content: US President Donald Trump appeared to dismiss an expiring nuclear treaty with Russia, saying in remarks released on Thursday that "if it expires, it expires."

title: US To Maintain Oversight Of Venezuela Much Longer Than 1 Year, Says Trump
content: President Donald Trump said the US will maintain oversight of Venezuela "much longer" than a year and his own judgment is the only limit to his global power, according to a New York Times interview published on Thursday.

title: "$100,000 Per Person": Team Trump's 'Money Plan' To Sway Greenlanders Amid Denmark's Warning
content: The Donald Trump administration in the United States is reportedly planning to offer money to each resident of Greenland to convince them to secede from Denmark and potentially join America.

title: Students Used Anonymous App For Answers Before Alerts During Brown Shooting
content: When a gunman began firing inside an academic building on the Brown University campus, students didn't wait for official alerts warning of trouble. They got information almost instantly, in bits and bursts  through phones vibrating in pockets

title: 'If There Was No Wall': Korean Leader Offers New Angle To Plane Crash
content: A South Korean government-commissioned report found the Jeju Air plane crash in December 2024 that killed 179 people might not have been deadly if there had not been a concrete mound at the end of the runway, an opposition lawmaker said.

title: Bihar Woman Beaten To Death After Being Blamed For Child's 'Brain' Illness
content: Blind belief, rumours and anger once again turned deadly in Bihar, where a 35-year-old woman was beaten to death after being accused of witchcraft, leaving two other women seriously injured.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Kerala's Minerals May Be India's Key To Long-Horizon Strategic Independence
content: Kerala's heavy minerals include monazite, ilmenite, rutile, zircon, and sillimanite - materials indispensable to energy transition, defence manufacturing, electronics, and advanced metallurgy. And yet, India has barely begun to value this endowment.

title: On Camera: Chain Snatching Attempt Inside Lift At Greater Noida High Rise
content: A disturbing incident has emerged from Greater Noida, where a man wearing a helmet tried to snatch the chain of an elderly woman.

title: Delhi Records Coldest Morning Of This Winter After Rain In Several Areas
content: Delhi recorded its coldest morning of this winter season on Friday, with a biting chill gripping the city as the minimum temperature plunged to its lowest level so far, even as trace rainfall was reported at several places across the national capital

title: Charges Open Way For Trial Against Lalu Yadav, Family In Land-For-Jobs Case
content: A court in Delhi today framed charges against Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Yadav and his family members for allegedly acquiring land in exchange for jobs when he was Union railway minister.

title: 3 Indians Among Crew On Board Russian Oil Tanker Seized By US
content: Three Indians are among the crew on board the Russian oil tanker seized by the US, local media reported even as Moscow on Thursday asked Washington to comply with international laws on freedom of maritime navigation.

title: From 'Peaceful' To Screams, Trinamool MPs Protest Outside Amit Shah Office
content: What began as a "peaceful protest" this morning, as claimed by Trinamool Congress MPs, in front of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's office in the national capital quickly changed into shouts and screams when the police moved in to clear them.

title: Iran Woman's "Bloody" Protest: "I Have Been Dead For 47 Years"
content: As Iran intensified efforts to crack down on anti-government protests, a video of an elderly woman protestor defying the Islamic regime went viral, becoming a symbol of nationwide agitation driven by economic hardship and growing public anger.

title: Iran Protests Live Updates: Iran Cuts Internet As Crowds Join Crown Prince-Led Protests
content: Iran's government cut off the country from the internet and international phone lines Thursday night as a demonstration organised by exiled Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi drew large crowds to the streets.

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
